project: GST Litigation Workflow - Comprehensive Mock Data
description: Complete workflow data for 30 cases across all lifecycle stages with hearings, tasks, documents, and lifecycle tracking

cases.title: ITC Reversal - Ineligible Supplies - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Scrutiny notice received questioning reversal of ITC on ineligible supplies under Section 17(5). Department alleges short reversal of Rs. 8.5 lakhs.

cases.title: E-way Bill Mismatch - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Audit notice for discrepancies in E-way bill reporting. Department identified mismatches between GSTR-1 and E-way bills for inter-state supplies.

cases.title: Refund Claim - Export of Services - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Refund application under Rule 89 for accumulated ITC due to zero-rated supplies (exports). Claim amount: Rs. 12.5 lakhs.

cases.title: Place of Supply Dispute - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Scrutiny for incorrect determination of place of supply leading to wrong tax payment (IGST vs CGST/SGST). Demand raised for differential tax.

cases.title: RCM Non-Compliance - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Demand notice for non-payment of GST under Reverse Charge Mechanism (RCM) on services received from unregistered vendors. Interest and penalty applicable.

cases.title: Classification Dispute - Industrial Equipment - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Audit questioning classification of certain machinery parts under lower tax rate. Department proposes reclassification leading to differential tax demand.

cases.title: ITC on Capital Goods - SCN Response - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Show Cause Notice issued denying ITC claimed on capital goods. Alleges goods not used for business purposes. Personal hearing conducted on 15/12/2024.

cases.title: Valuation Dispute - Related Party Transactions - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Demand for undervaluation of supplies to related parties. Department invoked Rule 28 alleging transactions below market value. Awaiting adjudication order.

cases.title: Time Limit - ITC Claim Beyond 180 Days - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: SCN for ITC claimed after 180 days from invoice date. Department seeks recovery of time-barred ITC claims. Written submissions filed.

cases.title: Fake Invoice Allegations - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Serious allegations of availing ITC on fake invoices from non-existent suppliers. Department conducted investigation. Client provided transportation and payment proofs.

cases.title: Excess ITC Distribution - ISD Mechanism - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Demand for excess ITC distributed through Input Service Distributor mechanism. Department alleges incorrect apportionment formula used.

cases.title: Job Work - Non-Compliance u/r 45 - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: SCN for non-compliance with job work provisions. Goods sent to job worker not returned within prescribed time limits under Rule 45.

cases.title: Appeal - ITC Denial on Services - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: First appeal against adjudication order denying ITC on consultancy services. Ground: Services directly related to business. Adjudication order dated 20/07/2023 confirming demand.

cases.title: Appeal - Late Filing Penalty - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Appeal against penalty imposed for late filing of GSTR-3B returns. Seeking waiver on grounds of reasonable cause due to technical glitches on portal.

cases.title: Appeal - Refund Rejection - Export Documentation - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Appeal against rejection of export refund claim. Adjudicating authority rejected due to incomplete shipping documents. All documents now submitted.

cases.title: Appeal - Classification of Composite Supply - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Appeal challenging classification of bundled supply as composite vs mixed supply. Tax rate difference resulting in significant demand. Strong case law support.

cases.title: Appeal - Excess Reversal of ITC - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Appeal against order confirming excess ITC reversal. Department's calculation methodology disputed. Ratio of exempt to taxable supplies is key issue.

cases.title: Appeal - Anti-Profiteering Investigation - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Appeal against anti-profiteering order alleging non-passing of GST rate reduction benefit to customers. Client maintained price stability was due to input cost increase.

cases.title: Tribunal - Cenvat Credit Transition - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Tribunal appeal against denial of transitional credit (TRAN-1) from pre-GST regime. Department disputed documentary evidence. Matter part-heard, final arguments scheduled.

cases.title: Tribunal - Works Contract - Mixed Supply Classification - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Works contract classification dispute - whether composite or mixed supply. Significant tax differential. Commissioner (Appeals) upheld adjudication order. Strong precedents cited.

cases.title: Tribunal - Profiteering - Market Forces Defense - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Anti-profiteering tribunal appeal. Arguing price maintained due to commodity price fluctuations, not retention of tax benefit. Economic analysis submitted.

cases.title: Tribunal - Time Limitation - Extended Period Invocation - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Challenging invocation of extended period and suppression allegations. Department invoked 5-year period without establishing willful misstatement. Limitation is key defense.

cases.title: Tribunal - Denial of Refund - Unjust Enrichment - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Refund denied invoking unjust enrichment doctrine. Client arguing tax burden not passed to customers as evidenced by pricing records. CA certificate submitted.

cases.title: Tribunal - Remand - Fresh Evidence Submission - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Case remanded by Tribunal to adjudicating authority for fresh consideration with additional documentary evidence. New evidence includes transporter certificates and bank statements.

cases.title: High Court - Constitutional Validity - ITC Restriction - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Writ petition challenging constitutional validity of Rule 86B restricting ITC utilization for cash payment. Arbitrary restriction violating Article 14. Interim stay granted on cash payment.

cases.title: High Court - Writ - Blocking of ITC Without Hearing - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Challenging blocking of ITC in electronic credit ledger without show cause notice and opportunity of hearing. Violation of natural justice principles. Stay obtained.

cases.title: High Court - Appeal from GSTAT - Interest on Refund - Vikas Engineering
cases.description: Appeal from GSTAT order denying interest on delayed refund. Substantial question of law: whether interest is automatic right or discretionary. Refund amount: Rs. 22 lakhs.

cases.title: High Court - Stay of Recovery - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Urgent writ for stay of recovery proceedings. Department attached bank accounts despite appeal pending. Disproportionate hardship. Conditional stay granted on deposit of 20%.

cases.title: Supreme Court - SLP - Interpretation of Supply - Sparsh Polymers
cases.description: Special Leave Petition against High Court order upholding taxability of free samples as supply. Involves interpretation of Schedule I read with Section 7. Matter of national importance.

cases.title: Supreme Court - Appeal - Limitation for Refund - Meera Textiles
cases.description: Civil Appeal on limitation period for refund claims. High Court ruled 2-year period is absolute. Arguing for equitable consideration in cases of systemic portal issues. Refund: Rs. 35 lakhs.

hearings.outcome: Adjournment granted on taxpayer's request to file additional documentary evidence. Department raised preliminary objection on time-barred documents.
hearings.notes: Client representative and CA attended. Department officer present. Directed to file reconciliation statement showing ITC reversal computation within 30 days.

hearings.judge_name: Sh. Vijay Patel, State Tax Officer
hearings.notes: First personal hearing scheduled. Need to prepare detailed reply with E-way bill register and GSTR-1 reconciliation.

hearings.outcome: Department raised query on export documentation. Shipping bill numbers to be verified with ICEGATE portal. Next hearing for verification.
hearings.notes: CA attended with export documents. Officer verified few shipping bills online during hearing. Balance verification pending.

hearings.judge_name: Sh. Vijay Patel, State Tax Officer
hearings.notes: Hearing scheduled to explain place of supply determination methodology and tax treatment followed.

hearings.outcome: Personal hearing concluded. Written submissions on RCM liability accepted. Officer mentioned demand may be reduced considering subsequent compliance. Order expected by end of January.
hearings.notes: Advocate attended. Detailed written submission filed explaining RCM compliance post-notice and payment of interest. Department acknowledged partial merit.
Critical hearing on classification. Need expert technical opinion and HSN classification precedents.

hearings.outcome: Arguments heard on nexus of capital goods with business activity. Department disputed end-use. Matter part-heard, final arguments scheduled for next hearing.
hearings.notes: Advocate presented case. Submitted installation certificates, usage logs, and chartered engineer certificate. Department to file counter on nexus issue.
Final hearing. Prepare closing arguments on eligible ITC claim with precedents on capital goods definition.

hearings.outcome: Department pressed for application of Rule 28. Taxpayer argued arm's length pricing followed. Officer directed to submit market survey data and comparable prices.
hearings.notes: CA attended with valuation report. Department skeptical of related party pricing. Next hearing critical for producing market comparables.

hearings.judge_name: Sh. Vijay Patel, State Tax Officer
hearings.outcome: Arguments on relaxation of time limit due to system issues. Department took time to verify portal downtime during relevant period. Written submissions accepted.
hearings.notes: Staff attended. Submitted GSTN portal maintenance notifications and email communications proving technical issues during claim period.

hearings.outcome: Department presented investigation report alleging non-genuine transactions. Taxpayer submitted transportation evidence and bank statements. Matter adjourned for cross-verification.
hearings.notes: Critical hearing. Investigation officer present. Client provided lorry receipts, weighbridge slips, and payment trail. Officer to verify supplier's GST status.

hearings.outcome: Cross-verification report received. Suppliers found to be existing entities with valid registrations. Department softened stance but questioning invoice authenticity. Final arguments scheduled.
hearings.notes: Breakthrough - Supplier verification confirmed legitimacy. Department now focusing on invoice matching. Need to produce original invoices and GRNs.
Final hearing on merits. Prepare comprehensive document bundle with original invoices, transport docs, payment proofs, and supplier correspondence.
First hearing on ISD mechanism. Need to explain ITC distribution formula and provide turnover computations.

hearings.judge_name: Sh. Vijay Patel, State Tax Officer
hearings.notes: Job work compliance hearing. Prepare movement register and correspondence with job worker.

hearings.outcome: Appellate authority questioned nexus of consultancy services. Argued services essential for business operations. Department cited Rule 42 restrictions. Matter part-heard.
hearings.notes: Advocate presented case with service invoices and business necessity justification. Authority asked for case law on consultancy services eligibility.

hearings.outcome: Precedents cited. Authority directed to file written submissions on case law applicability. Department to file counter. Final arguments scheduled.
hearings.notes: Submitted case law compilation - 8 favorable precedents from various High Courts. Department appeared to be impressed with legal position.
Final hearing. Prepare closing arguments emphasizing Supreme Court ratio on ITC eligibility and business nexus test.

hearings.outcome: Technical glitch evidence accepted. Authority directed to obtain portal downtime reports from GSTN. Reasonable cause appears established.
hearings.notes: CA presented case with GSTN acknowledgments and error screenshots. Authority sympathetic to technical issues argument.

hearings.outcome: Documents re-verified. Shipping bills matched with ICEGATE. Department conceded documentation now complete. Likely to allow refund.
hearings.notes: Strong position. All export documents verified. Officer indicated favorable order likely.

hearings.outcome: Arguments on composite vs mixed supply criteria. Cited Supreme Court judgment in Safari Retreats. Department defended lower authority's view. Matter part-heard.
hearings.notes: Complex legal issue. Advocate made strong arguments with precedents. Authority reserved questions for next hearing.

hearings.outcome: Detailed discussion on naturally bundled supply concept. Authority sought clarification on invoice presentation. Directed to file written note on supply composition.
hearings.notes: Authority appears to be considering our position. Critical to demonstrate naturally bundled character of supply.
First appeal hearing. Need to challenge ITC reversal computation methodology with detailed calculations.

hearings.outcome: Anti-profiteering allegations discussed. Argued cost increase absorbed benefit of rate reduction. Submitted raw material price trend analysis. Department to verify cost data.
hearings.notes: CA presented comprehensive cost analysis. Authority directed department to cross-check commodity price indices.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Tribunal questioned adequacy of transitional credit documentation. Directed to file additional CENVAT records from pre-GST period. Matter adjourned.
hearings.notes: Advocate appeared. Bench indicated documentary evidence needs strengthening. Directed to produce Form ER-1 returns and RG-23A registers.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Additional records filed and examined. Department raised fresh objection on certain input records. Matter part-heard, final arguments to be heard next.
hearings.notes: Pre-GST records scrutinized in detail. Technical member satisfied with ER-1 returns. Judicial member concerned about cross-verification.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Extensive arguments on transitional provisions. Bench reserved judgment. Likely to be decided within 30 days.
hearings.notes: Marathon hearing - 3 hours. Bench heard both sides comprehensively. Judicial member indicated precedents favor taxpayer.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.notes: Order dictation scheduled. Expect favorable outcome based on bench's observations during arguments.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Arguments on works contract classification commenced. Bench sought clarity on billing pattern and material-labor bifurcation. Matter part-heard.
hearings.notes: Advocate made preliminary submissions. Bench indicated Safari Retreats judgment will be key. Directed to file note on invoice-wise supply composition.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.notes: Anti-profiteering tribunal appeal. Prepare economic analysis and commodity price data to demonstrate cost increases.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Limitation arguments heard. Bench questioned department's evidence of willful suppression. Directed department to file note justifying extended period invocation.
hearings.notes: Strong hearing on limitation. Judicial member skeptical of suppression allegations. Department appeared weak on establishing mens rea.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.notes: Refund case on unjust enrichment. Prepare CA certificate and pricing records to prove tax burden not passed to customers.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Shri Justice Rajesh Sharma (Judicial) & Shri Ketan Patel (Technical)
hearings.outcome: Tribunal remanded matter to adjudicating authority for fresh consideration with new evidence. Directed to file all documents within 30 days before original authority.
hearings.notes: Partial victory. Case sent back for reconsideration. Now need to represent before Assistant Commissioner with strengthened documentary evidence.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Justice Harish Kumar & Justice Meera Desai
hearings.outcome: Division bench heard preliminary arguments on constitutional validity. Rule 86B restriction challenged as arbitrary. Interim stay on cash payment condition granted. Matter posted for final hearing.
hearings.notes: Writ admitted. Interim relief granted - major relief for client. Cash payment mandate stayed subject to furnishing bank guarantee.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Justice Harish Kumar & Justice Meera Desai
hearings.outcome: Detailed arguments on Article 14 violation. Bench sought Attorney General's assistance on constitutional question. Matter part-heard, next hearing in March.
hearings.notes: Significant constitutional question. Bench inclined to refer to larger bench. AG's office given time to file reply.

hearings.outcome: Urgent writ heard. Natural justice violation prima facie established. ITC blocking stayed subject to furnishing undertaking. Matter posted for final hearing.
hearings.notes: Emergency relief granted. Credit ledger unblocked. Undertaking filed to cooperate in investigation.

hearings.outcome: Detailed arguments on principles of natural justice. Bench directed department to issue show cause notice within 2 weeks. Matter kept on board for compliance monitoring.
hearings.notes: Strong observations by bench on procedural fairness. Department directed to follow due process.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Justice Meera Desai & Justice Ramesh Trivedi
hearings.notes: Appeal from GSTAT. Substantial question of law admitted: Whether interest on delayed refund is automatic or discretionary. Prepare legal arguments on statutory interpretation.

hearings.outcome: Urgent stay application heard. Bank attachment stayed conditionally upon deposit of 20% of disputed demand. Client to arrange funds within 15 days.
hearings.notes: Conditional stay granted. Need to arrange Rs. 17 lakhs immediately for deposit. Bank accounts to be unfrozen upon compliance.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Justice Ketan Shah (for SC listing)
hearings.outcome: SLP admitted by Supreme Court. Notice issued to respondent. Interim stay on recovery granted. Matter posted for final hearing.
hearings.notes: Major milestone - SLP admitted. Stay obtained. Respondent to file counter within 8 weeks.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble the Chief Justice & Hon'ble Justice Ramesh Kumar
hearings.outcome: Matter listed before constitutional bench. Arguments on interpretation of 'supply' under Section 7 to be heard. Leading counsel engaged.
hearings.notes: Constitutional bench matter. Senior counsel briefed. Involves fundamental question of GST levy on free supplies.

hearings.judge_name: Hon'ble Justice Meera Desai & Hon'ble Justice Harish Kumar
hearings.outcome: Civil appeal admitted. Question of law framed on limitation period for refund claims. Department filed counter affidavit. Matter posted for final arguments.
hearings.notes: Important limitation question. Portal failure evidence critical. Senior advocate to argue on equitable considerations.

tasks.title: Review ASMT-10 Scrutiny Notice
tasks.description: Detailed analysis of scrutiny notice questioning ITC reversal on ineligible supplies. Identify specific objections raised by department.

tasks.title: Prepare ITC Reversal Reconciliation Statement
tasks.description: Compile detailed reconciliation showing ITC claimed, reversals made under Section 17(5), and supporting calculations with invoice-wise breakup.

tasks.title: Client Consultation - ITC Dispute Strategy
tasks.description: Meeting with client to discuss ITC reversal methodology, department's allegations, and response strategy. Explain legal position and compliance requirements.

tasks.title: Draft ASMT-10 Reply on GST Portal
tasks.description: Prepare comprehensive reply to scrutiny notice with supporting documents, reconciliation statement, and legal justifications. File on GST portal before deadline.

tasks.title: Review ASMT-11 Audit Notice
tasks.description: Analyze audit notice highlighting E-way bill and GSTR-1 discrepancies. Identify specific invoice numbers and transactions under query.

tasks.title: Prepare E-way Bill vs GSTR-1 Reconciliation
tasks.description: Create detailed reconciliation between E-way bills generated and invoices reported in GSTR-1 for disputed inter-state supplies. Identify and explain variances.

tasks.title: Client Meeting - E-way Bill Compliance
tasks.description: Discuss E-way bill generation process, identify gaps, and implement corrective measures for future compliance.

tasks.title: Draft ASMT-11 Reply
tasks.description: Prepare detailed written response to audit findings with reconciliation statement, transport documents, and explanation of variances.

tasks.title: Review Refund Application Status
tasks.description: Check status of refund application filed under Rule 89. Identify documents pending and deficiencies raised by department.

tasks.title: Compile Export Documentation
tasks.description: Gather all export-related documents: shipping bills, BRCs, FIRC certificates, export invoices, and match with refund claim statement.

tasks.title: Client Consultation - Refund Claim Process
tasks.description: Explain refund claim process, timeline, and documentation requirements. Discuss follow-up actions and expected outcome.

tasks.title: Submit Additional Documents for Refund
tasks.description: File additional export documents as directed by department including ICEGATE verification reports and updated bank realization certificates.

tasks.title: Analyze Show Cause Notice - Capital Goods ITC
tasks.description: Detailed review of SCN denying ITC on capital goods. Identify specific allegations, evidence relied upon by department, and prepare defense strategy.

tasks.title: Compile Evidence - Capital Goods Usage
tasks.description: Gather installation certificates, user manuals, chartered engineer certificate, electricity bills, production records proving business use of disputed capital goods.

tasks.title: Draft Written Submissions for Personal Hearing
tasks.description: Prepare detailed written submissions addressing each allegation in SCN with legal precedents, evidence references, and arguments on eligible ITC.

tasks.title: Prepare for Final Adjudication Hearing
tasks.description: Final preparation for personal hearing including evidence compilation, case law research, and client briefing. Prepare oral arguments on ITC eligibility.

tasks.title: Review Investigation Report - Fake Invoice Allegations
tasks.description: Critical analysis of investigation report alleging fake invoices. Review department's evidence, cross-check with internal records, identify factual errors.

tasks.title: Gather Transaction Evidence - Supplier Genuineness
tasks.description: Compile comprehensive evidence proving genuineness of transactions: lorry receipts, weighbridge slips, e-way bills, gate entry registers, GRNs, quality check reports, payment proofs.

tasks.title: Obtain Supplier Cooperation - Affidavits & Documents
tasks.description: Coordinate with suppliers to obtain sworn affidavits, GST registration certificates, bank statements, and authorization letters supporting transaction genuineness.

tasks.title: Draft Comprehensive Response to SCN
tasks.description: Prepare detailed written response to fake invoice allegations with point-by-point rebuttal, documentary evidence, legal precedents on bonafide purchaser doctrine.

tasks.title: Prepare Appeal Memorandum - ITC Denial
tasks.description: Draft detailed appeal memorandum challenging adjudication order denying ITC on consultancy services. Frame grounds of appeal and legal arguments.

tasks.title: Research Case Law - Consultancy Services ITC
tasks.description: Comprehensive legal research on ITC eligibility for consultancy services. Compile High Court and Supreme Court judgments supporting taxpayer's position.

tasks.title: Draft Written Submissions for Appeal Hearing
tasks.description: Prepare detailed written submissions with case law citations, factual matrix, and legal arguments on business nexus test for ITC eligibility.

tasks.title: Prepare Final Arguments for Appeal
tasks.description: Prepare comprehensive closing arguments emphasizing Supreme Court precedents on ITC eligibility and distinguishing adverse judgments cited by department.

tasks.title: Compile Pre-GST CENVAT Credit Records
tasks.description: Gather all pre-GST excise/service tax records: Form ER-1 returns, RG-23A Part II registers, invoices, and TRAN-1 working for transitional credit claim.

tasks.title: Draft Tribunal Appeal Memorandum
tasks.description: Prepare detailed appeal memorandum before GSTAT challenging denial of transitional credit. Frame legal questions and factual grounds comprehensively.

tasks.title: File Additional Documents - Pre-GST Records
tasks.description: Submit additional pre-GST documentary evidence as directed by Tribunal including Form ER-1 returns, RG registers, and cross-verification certificates.

tasks.title: Prepare Final Arguments for Tribunal
tasks.description: Prepare comprehensive final arguments on transitional credit eligibility with precedents on documentary evidence requirements and TRAN-1 validity.

tasks.title: Draft Writ Petition - Rule 86B Challenge
tasks.description: Prepare comprehensive writ petition challenging constitutional validity of Rule 86B restricting ITC utilization. Frame constitutional questions under Article 14 and 19(1)(g).

tasks.title: Research Constitutional Law - Rule 86B
tasks.description: Comprehensive research on constitutional validity of ITC restrictions. Study Article 14 arbitrariness test, Article 19(1)(g) business freedom, and relevant Supreme Court precedents.

tasks.title: Prepare for Constitutional Bench Arguments
tasks.description: Extensive preparation for arguments before larger bench. Prepare written note on constitutional questions, precedents on rule-making power, and proportionality test.

tasks.title: Draft Special Leave Petition
tasks.description: Prepare comprehensive SLP before Supreme Court challenging High Court order on taxability of free samples. Frame substantial questions of law of national importance.

tasks.title: Engage Senior Counsel for Supreme Court
tasks.description: Brief senior counsel for Supreme Court arguments. Prepare detailed compilation of case records, questions of law, and legal research on definition of 'supply' under GST.

tasks.title: Prepare Written Note for Constitutional Bench
tasks.description: Draft comprehensive written submissions for constitutional bench hearing. Address interpretation of Section 7, Schedule I, and legislative intent behind taxing free supplies.
